question.text: The _______ was the first European country to establish trade relations with India by sea.

questions.explanation: Portugal, led by Vasco da Gama, was the first to reach India by sea in 1498.

question.text: Vasco da Gama first landed at _______ in 1498.

questions.explanation: Vasco da Gama landed at Calicut on the Malabar Coast, establishing the Portuguese presence in India.

question.text: The first trading post established by the Portuguese in India was at _______.

questions.explanation: The Portuguese established their first trading post in Cochin in 1503.

question.text: The British East India Company was granted a charter by Queen _______ in 1600.

questions.explanation: Queen Elizabeth I granted a charter to the British East India Company in 1600.

question.text: The first British factory in India was established at _______ in 1613.

questions.explanation: The British set up their first factory in Surat after securing permission from Mughal Emperor Jahangir.

question.text: The Dutch East India Company was established in the year _______.

questions.explanation: The Dutch East India Company was founded in 1602 to control trade with the East Indies.

question.text: Goa was captured by the Portuguese in the year _______.

questions.explanation: Afonso de Albuquerque captured Goa from the Sultan of Bijapur in 1510.

question.text: The French established their first settlement in India at _______.

questions.explanation: The French set up their first trading post at Pondicherry in 1674.

question.text: The Treaty of _______ in 1763 marked the end of the Seven Years' War.

questions.explanation: The Treaty of Paris ended the Seven Years' War and limited French influence in India.

question.text: The Battle of _______ in 1757 marked the beginning of British dominance in Bengal.

questions.explanation: The Battle of Plassey resulted in the defeat of Nawab Siraj-ud-Daulah by the British.

question.text: The Dutch shifted their focus from India to the _______ Archipelago.

questions.explanation: The Dutch focused on Indonesia, reducing their presence in India.

question.text: The _______ Company emerged as the dominant European trading power by the late 18th century.

questions.explanation: The British East India Company became the dominant power in India by the late 18th century.

question.text: The English acquired the city of _______ from the Portuguese as part of a royal marriage dowry in 1661.

questions.explanation: Bombay was given to the British as dowry when Charles II married the Portuguese princess Catherine of Braganza.

question.text: The Treaty of _______ ended the First Anglo-French Carnatic War in 1748.

questions.explanation: The Treaty of Aix-la-Chapelle ended the First Carnatic War between the British and the French.

question.text: The Second Anglo-French Carnatic War ended with the Treaty of _______.

questions.explanation: The Treaty of Pondicherry ended the Second Carnatic War in 1754.

question.text: The first English settlement in India was at _______ in 1611.

questions.explanation: The English established their first settlement in Masulipatnam in 1611.

question.text: The French Governor _______ strengthened French influence in India during the 18th century.

questions.explanation: Joseph François Dupleix played a significant role in expanding French influence in southern India.

question.text: The British constructed _______ in Madras to protect their trading interests.

questions.explanation: Fort St. George was built by the British in Madras in 1644.

question.text: The French constructed _______ in Pondicherry as their main fortification.

questions.explanation: Fort Louis was constructed by the French to secure their base at Pondicherry.

question.text: The Dutch captured _______ from the Portuguese in 1656.

questions.explanation: The Dutch captured Ceylon from the Portuguese, weakening their influence in Asia.

question.text: The _______ marked the decline of Portuguese dominance in India.

questions.explanation: The Battle of Diu in 1509 marked the decline of Portuguese power as other European nations gained prominence.

question.text: In 1757, the British defeated Nawab Siraj-ud-Daulah at the Battle of _______.

questions.explanation: The Battle of Plassey established British political dominance in Bengal.

question.text: Robert Clive was a key figure in securing British victory at the Battle of _______.

questions.explanation: Robert Clive's leadership was pivotal to the British victory at Plassey in 1757.

question.text: The French established trading centers in Chandernagore and _______.

questions.explanation: The French established their main trading centers in Chandernagore and Pondicherry.

question.text: The _______ were known for their monopoly on the spice trade in India.

questions.explanation: The Portuguese controlled the spice trade from the early 16th century.

question.text: The _______ was the first British Governor of Bengal after the Battle of Plassey.

questions.explanation: Robert Clive became the first British Governor of Bengal after the British victory at Plassey.

question.text: The Treaty of _______ in 1783 ended the American War of Independence and impacted European colonial powers.

questions.explanation: The Treaty of Paris ended the American War of Independence and reshaped European colonial dynamics.

question.text: The _______ were the first European power to establish a naval presence in the Indian Ocean.

questions.explanation: The Portuguese established a naval presence in the Indian Ocean to control trade routes.

question.text: Francisco de Almeida implemented the _______ Policy to strengthen Portuguese naval dominance.

questions.explanation: Francisco de Almeida introduced the 'Blue Water Policy' to enhance Portuguese maritime strength.

question.text: The _______ were the first to challenge Portuguese supremacy in India.

questions.explanation: The Dutch were the first to challenge Portuguese dominance in India by capturing ports.

question.text: The Dutch East India Company was known as _______ in Dutch.

questions.explanation: The Dutch East India Company was officially called the Vereenigde Oostindische Compagnie (VOC).

question.text: The French Governor-General _______ led the French during the Second Carnatic War.

questions.explanation: Joseph François Dupleix was the French Governor-General who led the French forces during the Carnatic Wars.

question.text: The Portuguese explorer _______ succeeded Vasco da Gama and consolidated Portuguese power in India.

questions.explanation: Afonso de Albuquerque captured Goa and strengthened Portuguese control in India.

question.text: The British acquired _______ from the Dutch through the Anglo-Dutch Treaty of 1824.

questions.explanation: Under the Anglo-Dutch Treaty of 1824, the British took over Malacca, while the Dutch focused on Indonesia.

question.text: The Battle of _______ in 1764 resulted in the British gaining control over Bengal, Bihar, and Orissa.

questions.explanation: The Battle of Buxar consolidated British control over Bengal, Bihar, and Orissa.

question.text: The French and British fought three major conflicts in India known as the _______ Wars.

questions.explanation: The Carnatic Wars were fought between the British and the French for dominance in southern India.

question.text: The Portuguese capital in India was established at _______.

questions.explanation: Goa became the capital of Portuguese India in 1510.

question.text: The Dutch established their headquarters in India at _______.

questions.explanation: The Dutch East India Company established Pulicat as their headquarters in India.

question.text: The English obtained permission to establish a factory at Madras from the local ruler of _______.

questions.explanation: The English acquired land at Madras through permission from the ruler of Chandragiri in 1639.

question.text: The _______ established a trading post at Surat in 1616, marking their entry into India.

questions.explanation: The Dutch established a factory at Surat in 1616 to compete with the British and Portuguese.

question.text: The First Carnatic War was part of a larger European conflict called the War of _______.

questions.explanation: The First Carnatic War was linked to the War of Austrian Succession in Europe.

question.text: The Second Carnatic War ended with the Treaty of _______ in 1754.

questions.explanation: The Treaty of Pondicherry ended hostilities between the British and the French in the Second Carnatic War.

question.text: The English East India Company shifted its headquarters from Surat to _______ in 1687.

questions.explanation: The British East India Company moved its headquarters to Bombay to consolidate its trade presence.

question.text: The French East India Company was established under the reign of King _______.

questions.explanation: The French East India Company was founded by King Louis XIV in 1664.

question.text: The Portuguese explorer _______ was the first to reach India by sea in 1498.

questions.explanation: Vasco da Gama reached India by sea, landing at Calicut in 1498.

question.text: The British established the Presidency of _______ in 1684, which became a key administrative center.

questions.explanation: Madras was established as a Presidency in 1684 by the British East India Company.

question.text: The Dutch established their first factory in India at _______.

questions.explanation: The Dutch set up their first trading post at Masulipatnam in 1605.

question.text: The Treaty of _______ in 1763 limited French territorial possessions in India.

questions.explanation: The Treaty of Paris ended the Seven Years' War and restricted French possessions in India.

question.text: The Portuguese lost control of Ceylon to the _______ in 1658.

questions.explanation: The Dutch captured Ceylon from the Portuguese, marking the decline of Portuguese influence in the region.

question.text: The Battle of _______ in 1761 marked the defeat of the French in India during the Third Carnatic War.

questions.explanation: The Battle of Wandiwash marked the decisive defeat of the French by the British in 1761.
